description: abstract image; black spiral, ULC; curving black line, LLC; black circle, LRC; large red circle at center bottom; two V-shapes--blue and yellow--at upper right
image_copyright: © Calder Foundation%2C New York %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
provenance: Dayton’s Gallery 12, Minneapolis (G05009; F1775-55); Bruce B. Dayton, Wayzata, Minn. (inv. no. 67-2); Estate of Bruce B. Dayton; bequeathed to MIA, 2016
text: In the 1940s, Alexander Calder explored surrealist compositions based on floating hieroglyphic forms. In the 60s, he returned to such compositions but with brightly colored, simplified elements that resonated with the Pop Art of the time. The title Fronton refers to the court used for the fast-paced Basque sport of jai alai, in which players use gloves with banana-shaped basket extensions to catch and propel a ball with breathtaking speed.
title: Fronton
